page.title: 05Garton Wives Club
page.content: Garton Wives Club was formed in 1970 when it was called Young Wives Club.At that time there were no other clubs or socials institutions and a number of people felt that the village needed a club for ladies. Officers are elected every year and forty members are charged Â£1 a year and 30p a month. Originally the club was associated with the Church and membership was restricted to Garton Parish.Falling numbers brought about rule changes. The name was changed to Garton Wives and membership was extended to nearby villages and Driffield. The club meets once a month and a variety of speakers are invited. Members go on outings,shopping trips, treasure hunts and visit the theatre. All surplus income is given to a variety of charities.
